Concerning the Ammonites<S>1121</S> <S>5983</S>, thus saith<S>559</S> the LORD<S>3068</S>; Hath Israel<S>3478</S> no sons<S>1121</S>? hath he no heir<S>3423</S>? why then doth their king<S>4428</S> inherit<S>3423</S> Gad<S>1410</S>, and his people<S>5971</S> dwell<S>3427</S> in his cities<S>5892</S>? <sup>Concerning: or, Against</sup> <sup>their king: or, Melcom</sup>
Therefore, behold, the days<S>3117</S> come<S>935</S>, saith<S>559</S> the LORD<S>3068</S>, that I will cause an alarm<S>8643</S> of war<S>4421</S> to be heard<S>8085</S> in Rabbah<S>7237</S> of the Ammonites<S>1121</S> <S>5983</S>; and it shall be a desolate<S>8077</S> heap<S>8510</S>, and her daughters<S>1323</S> shall be burned<S>3341</S> with fire<S>784</S>: then shall Israel<S>3478</S> be heir<S>3423</S> unto them that were his heirs<S>3423</S>, saith<S>5002</S> the LORD<S>3068</S>.
Howl<S>3213</S>, O Heshbon<S>2809</S>, for Ai<S>5857</S> is spoiled<S>7703</S>: cry<S>6817</S>, ye daughters<S>1323</S> of Rabbah<S>7237</S>, gird<S>2296</S> you with sackcloth<S>8242</S>; lament<S>5594</S>, and run to and fro<S>7751</S> by the hedges<S>1448</S>; for their king<S>4428</S> shall go<S>3212</S> into captivity<S>1473</S>, and his priests<S>3548</S> and his princes<S>8269</S> together<S>3162</S>. <sup>their king: or, Melcom</sup>
Wherefore gloriest<S>1984</S> thou in the valleys<S>6010</S>, thy flowing<S>2100</S> valley<S>6010</S>, O backsliding<S>7728</S> daughter<S>1323</S>? that trusted<S>982</S> in her treasures<S>214</S>, saying, Who shall come<S>935</S> unto me? <sup>thy: or, thy valley floweth away</sup>
Behold, I will bring<S>935</S> a fear<S>6343</S> upon thee, saith<S>5002</S> the Lord<S>136</S> GOD<S>3069</S> of hosts<S>6635</S>, from all those that be about<S>5439</S> thee; and ye shall be driven out<S>5080</S> every man<S>376</S> right forth<S>6440</S>; and none shall gather up<S>6908</S> him that wandereth<S>5074</S>.
And afterward<S>310</S> I will bring again<S>7725</S> the captivity<S>7622</S> of the children<S>1121</S> of Ammon<S>5983</S>, saith<S>5002</S> the LORD<S>3068</S>.
Concerning Edom<S>123</S>, thus saith<S>559</S> the LORD<S>3068</S> of hosts<S>6635</S>; Is wisdom<S>2451</S> no more in Teman<S>8487</S>? is counsel<S>6098</S> perished<S>6</S> from the prudent<S>995</S>? is their wisdom<S>2451</S> vanished<S>5628</S>?
Flee<S>5127</S> ye, turn back<S>6437</S>, dwell<S>3427</S> deep<S>6009</S>, O inhabitants<S>3427</S> of Dedan<S>1719</S>; for I will bring<S>935</S> the calamity<S>343</S> of Esau<S>6215</S> upon him, the time<S>6256</S> that I will visit<S>6485</S> him. <sup>turn: or, they are turned back</sup>
If grapegatherers<S>1219</S> come<S>935</S> to thee, would they not leave<S>7604</S> some gleaning grapes<S>5955</S>? if thieves<S>1590</S> by night<S>3915</S>, they will destroy<S>7843</S> till they have enough<S>1767</S>. <sup>till: Heb. their sufficiency</sup>
But I have made Esau<S>6215</S> bare<S>2834</S>, I have uncovered<S>1540</S> his secret places<S>4565</S>, and he shall not be able<S>3201</S> to hide<S>2247</S> himself: his seed<S>2233</S> is spoiled<S>7703</S>, and his brethren<S>251</S>, and his neighbours<S>7934</S>, and he is not.
Leave<S>5800</S> thy fatherless children<S>3490</S>, I will preserve them alive<S>2421</S>; and let thy widows<S>490</S> trust<S>982</S> in me.
For thus saith<S>559</S> the LORD<S>3068</S>; Behold, they whose judgment<S>4941</S> was not to drink<S>8354</S> of the cup<S>3563</S> have assuredly<S>8354</S> drunken<S>8354</S>; and art thou he that shall altogether<S>5352</S> go unpunished<S>5352</S>? thou shalt not go unpunished<S>5352</S>, but thou shalt surely<S>8354</S> drink<S>8354</S> of it.
For I have sworn<S>7650</S> by myself, saith<S>5002</S> the LORD<S>3068</S>, that Bozrah<S>1224</S> shall become a desolation<S>8047</S>, a reproach<S>2781</S>, a waste<S>2721</S>, and a curse<S>7045</S>; and all the cities<S>5892</S> thereof shall be perpetual<S>5769</S> wastes<S>2723</S>.
I have heard<S>8085</S> a rumour<S>8052</S> from the LORD<S>3068</S>, and an ambassador<S>6735</S> is sent<S>7971</S> unto the heathen<S>1471</S>, saying, Gather ye together<S>6908</S>, and come<S>935</S> against her, and rise up<S>6965</S> to the battle<S>4421</S>.
For, lo, I will make<S>5414</S> thee small<S>6996</S> among the heathen<S>1471</S>, and despised<S>959</S> among men<S>120</S>.
Thy terribleness<S>8606</S> hath deceived<S>5377</S> thee, and the pride<S>2087</S> of thine heart<S>3820</S>, O thou that dwellest<S>7931</S> in the clefts<S>2288</S> of the rock<S>5553</S>, that holdest<S>8610</S> the height<S>4791</S> of the hill<S>1389</S>: though thou shouldest make thy nest<S>7064</S> as high<S>1361</S> as the eagle<S>5404</S>, I will bring thee down<S>3381</S> from thence, saith<S>5002</S> the LORD<S>3068</S>.
Also Edom<S>123</S> shall be a desolation<S>8047</S>: every one that goeth<S>5674</S> by it shall be astonished<S>8074</S>, and shall hiss<S>8319</S> at all the plagues<S>4347</S> thereof.
As in the overthrow<S>4114</S> of Sodom<S>5467</S> and Gomorrah<S>6017</S> and the neighbour<S>7934</S> cities thereof, saith<S>559</S> the LORD<S>3068</S>, no man<S>376</S> shall abide<S>3427</S> there, neither shall a son<S>1121</S> of man<S>120</S> dwell<S>1481</S> in it.
Behold, he shall come up<S>5927</S> like a lion<S>738</S> from the swelling<S>1347</S> of Jordan<S>3383</S> against the habitation<S>5116</S> of the strong<S>386</S>: but I will suddenly<S>7280</S> make him run away<S>7323</S> from her: and who is a chosen<S>977</S> man, that I may appoint<S>6485</S> over her? for who is like me? and who will appoint me the time<S>3259</S>? and who is that shepherd<S>7462</S> that will stand<S>5975</S> before<S>6440</S> me? <sup>appoint me: or, convent me in judgment?</sup>
Therefore hear<S>8085</S> the counsel<S>6098</S> of the LORD<S>3068</S>, that he hath taken<S>3289</S> against Edom<S>123</S>; and his purposes<S>4284</S>, that he hath purposed<S>2803</S> against the inhabitants<S>3427</S> of Teman<S>8487</S>: Surely the least<S>6810</S> of the flock<S>6629</S> shall draw them out<S>5498</S>: surely he shall make their habitations<S>5116</S> desolate<S>8074</S> with them.
The earth<S>776</S> is moved<S>7493</S> at the noise<S>6963</S> of their fall<S>5307</S>, at the cry<S>6818</S> the noise<S>6963</S> thereof was heard<S>8085</S> in the Red<S>5488</S> sea<S>3220</S>. <sup>Red sea: Heb. Weedy sea</sup>
Behold, he shall come up<S>5927</S> and fly<S>1675</S> as the eagle<S>5404</S>, and spread<S>6566</S> his wings<S>3671</S> over Bozrah<S>1224</S>: and at that day<S>3117</S> shall the heart<S>3820</S> of the mighty men<S>1368</S> of Edom<S>123</S> be as the heart<S>3820</S> of a woman<S>802</S> in her pangs<S>6887</S>.
Concerning Damascus<S>1834</S>. Hamath<S>2574</S> is confounded<S>954</S>, and Arpad<S>774</S>: for they have heard<S>8085</S> evil<S>7451</S> tidings<S>8052</S>: they are fainthearted<S>4127</S>; there is sorrow<S>1674</S> on the sea<S>3220</S>; it cannot<S>3201</S> be quiet<S>8252</S>. <sup>fainthearted: Heb. melted</sup> <sup>on: or, as on the sea</sup>
Damascus<S>1834</S> is waxed feeble<S>7503</S>, and turneth<S>6437</S> herself to flee<S>5127</S>, and fear<S>7374</S> hath seized<S>2388</S> on her: anguish<S>6869</S> and sorrows<S>2256</S> have taken<S>270</S> her, as a woman in travail<S>3205</S>.
How is the city<S>5892</S> of praise<S>8416</S> not left<S>5800</S>, the city<S>7151</S> of my joy<S>4885</S>!
Therefore her young men<S>970</S> shall fall<S>5307</S> in her streets<S>7339</S>, and all the men<S>582</S> of war<S>4421</S> shall be cut off<S>1826</S> in that day<S>3117</S>, saith<S>5002</S> the LORD<S>3068</S> of hosts<S>6635</S>.
And I will kindle<S>3341</S> a fire<S>784</S> in the wall<S>2346</S> of Damascus<S>1834</S>, and it shall consume<S>398</S> the palaces<S>759</S> of Benhadad<S>1130</S>.
Concerning Kedar<S>6938</S>, and concerning the kingdoms<S>4467</S> of Hazor<S>2674</S>, which Nebuchadrezzar<S>5019</S> king<S>4428</S> of Babylon<S>894</S> shall smite<S>5221</S>, thus saith<S>559</S> the LORD<S>3068</S>; Arise<S>6965</S> ye, go up<S>5927</S> to Kedar<S>6938</S>, and spoil<S>7703</S> the men<S>1121</S> of the east<S>6924</S>.
Their tents<S>168</S> and their flocks<S>6629</S> shall they take away<S>3947</S>: they shall take<S>5375</S> to themselves their curtains<S>3407</S>, and all their vessels<S>3627</S>, and their camels<S>1581</S>; and they shall cry<S>7121</S> unto them, Fear<S>4032</S> is on every side<S>5439</S>.
Flee<S>5127</S>, get<S>5110</S> you far off<S>3966</S>, dwell<S>3427</S> deep<S>6009</S>, O ye inhabitants<S>3427</S> of Hazor<S>2674</S>, saith<S>5002</S> the LORD<S>3068</S>; for Nebuchadrezzar<S>5019</S> king<S>4428</S> of Babylon<S>894</S> hath taken counsel<S>6098</S> <S>3289</S> against you, and hath conceived<S>2803</S> a purpose<S>4284</S> against you. <sup>get: Heb. flit greatly</sup>
Arise<S>6965</S>, get you up<S>5927</S> unto the wealthy<S>7961</S> nation<S>1471</S>, that dwelleth<S>3427</S> without care<S>983</S>, saith<S>5002</S> the LORD<S>3068</S>, which have neither gates<S>1817</S> nor bars<S>1280</S>, which dwell<S>7931</S> alone<S>910</S>. <sup>wealthy: or, that is at ease</sup>
And their camels<S>1581</S> shall be a booty<S>957</S>, and the multitude<S>1995</S> of their cattle<S>4735</S> a spoil<S>7998</S>: and I will scatter<S>2219</S> into all winds<S>7307</S> them that are in the utmost<S>7112</S> corners<S>6285</S>; and I will bring<S>935</S> their calamity<S>343</S> from all sides<S>5676</S> thereof, saith<S>5002</S> the LORD<S>3068</S>. <sup>in: Heb. cut off into corners, or, that have the corners of their hair polled</sup>
And Hazor<S>2674</S> shall be a dwelling<S>4583</S> for dragons<S>8577</S>, and a desolation<S>8077</S> for<S>5704</S> ever<S>5769</S>: there shall no man<S>376</S> abide<S>3427</S> there, nor any son<S>1121</S> of man<S>120</S> dwell<S>1481</S> in it.
The word<S>1697</S> of the LORD<S>3068</S> that came to Jeremiah<S>3414</S> the prophet<S>5030</S> against Elam<S>5867</S> in the beginning<S>7225</S> of the reign<S>4438</S> of Zedekiah<S>6667</S> king<S>4428</S> of Judah<S>3063</S>, saying<S>559</S>,
Thus saith<S>559</S> the LORD<S>3068</S> of hosts<S>6635</S>; Behold, I will break<S>7665</S> the bow<S>7198</S> of Elam<S>5867</S>, the chief<S>7225</S> of their might<S>1369</S>.
And upon Elam<S>5867</S> will I bring<S>935</S> the four<S>702</S> winds<S>7307</S> from the four<S>702</S> quarters<S>7098</S> of heaven<S>8064</S>, and will scatter<S>2219</S> them toward all those winds<S>7307</S>; and there shall be no nation<S>1471</S> whither the outcasts<S>5080</S> of Elam<S>5867</S> <S>5769</S> shall not come<S>935</S>.
For I will cause Elam<S>5867</S> to be dismayed<S>2865</S> before<S>6440</S> their enemies<S>341</S>, and before<S>6440</S> them that seek<S>1245</S> their life<S>5315</S>: and I will bring<S>935</S> evil<S>7451</S> upon them, even my fierce<S>2740</S> anger<S>639</S>, saith<S>5002</S> the LORD<S>3068</S>; and I will send<S>7971</S> the sword<S>2719</S> after<S>310</S> them, till I have consumed<S>3615</S> them:
And I will set<S>7760</S> my throne<S>3678</S> in Elam<S>5867</S>, and will destroy<S>6</S> from thence the king<S>4428</S> and the princes<S>8269</S>, saith<S>5002</S> the LORD<S>3068</S>.
But it shall come to pass in the latter<S>319</S> days<S>3117</S>, that I will bring again<S>7725</S> <S>7725</S> the captivity<S>7622</S> <S>7622</S> of Elam<S>5867</S>, saith<S>5002</S> the LORD<S>3068</S>.
